edu.stolaf.transit_timer
Class Client

java.lang.Object
  edu.stolaf.transit_timer.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The Client class implements Runnable so that we can call a new thread to interact with the Postgres DB via a new Socket. We can't run sockets in the main Activity thread, so we must do so via these Clients.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getErr()
          Getter for the err String from the Client (where errors are stored).
 java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
          Getter for the InputStream of the Client Socket.
 java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
          Getter for the OutputStream of the Client Socket.
 java.lang.String getResult()
          Getter for the result String from the Client (where results of queries are stored).
 java.net.Socket getSocket()
          Getter for the Socket of the Client.
static void launchClient(Client client)
          Function to launch client by calling a Thread and then waiting for its activity to finish (we don't need high level parallel performance.
 void run()
          The run() method which we need to override for Runnable.

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

launchClient

public static void launchClient(Client client)
Function to launch client by calling a Thread and then waiting for its activity to finish (we don't need high level parallel performance.

Parameters:
client - A new instance of Client. The function is static, so it can be called without instantiating a Client object.
Throws:
none

run

public void run()
The run() method which we need to override for Runnable. Establishes a new connection and then writes a message to the OutputStream, waiting for a response over the InputStream.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Parameters:
none -
Throws:
none
